DataElement.preferredName: Prostate Cancer cT1 TNM Finding Digital Rectal Examination Assessment Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text statement to describe the extent of the clinical spread of prostate cancer (cT1) in which the Digital Rectal Exam (DRE) showed no evidence of induration or nodularity (tumor inapparent by palpation or imaging).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prostate Cancer cT1 TNM Finding Digital Rectal Examination Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Clinically inapparent tumor neither palpable nor visible by imaging. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)_An examination that checks for abnormalities of organs or other structures in the pelvis and lower abdomen. During a digital rectal exam, a health professional inserts a lubricated, gloved finger of one hand into the rectum and may use the other hand to press on the lower abdomen or pelvic area._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Prostate Cancer cT1 TNM Finding v7
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Clinically inapparent tumor neither palpable nor visible by imaging. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Prostate Cancer cT1 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Clinically inapparent tumor neither palpable nor visible by imaging. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Property.preferredDefinition: An examination that checks for abnormalities of organs or other structures in the pelvis and lower abdomen. During a digital rectal exam, a health professional inserts a lubricated, gloved finger of one hand into the rectum and may use the other hand to press on the lower abdomen or pelvic area.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: An examination that checks for abnormalities of organs or other structures in the pelvis and lower abdomen. During a digital rectal exam, a health professional inserts a lubricated, gloved finger of one hand into the rectum and may use the other hand to press on the lower abdomen or pelvic area.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Released per approval by B.McClure-Shimel. mc 1/18/12

ValueDomain.preferredName: Prostate Cancer cT1 TNM Finding Edition 7 Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Clinically inapparent tumor neither palpable nor visible by imaging. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)_The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

PermissibleValues.value: Tumor Identified by Needle Biopsy (cT1c) [e.g., because of elevated PSA]
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Prostate Cancer cT1c TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Prostate Cancer cT1c TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Tumor identified by needle biopsy (e.g., because of elevated PSA). (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Prostate Cancer cT1c TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Tumor identified by needle biopsy (e.g., because of elevated PSA). (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.value: Tumor Incidental Histologic Finding in > 5% of Tissue Resected at TURP (cT1b)
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Prostate Cancer cT1b TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Prostate Cancer cT1b TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Tumor incidental histologic finding in more than 5% of tissue resected. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Prostate Cancer cT1b TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Tumor incidental histologic finding in more than 5% of tissue resected. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.value: Tumor Incidental Finding in ≤ 5% of tissue Resected at TURP (cT1a)
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Prostate Cancer cT1a TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Prostate Cancer cT1a TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Tumor incidental histologic finding in 5% or less of tissue resected. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Prostate Cancer cT1a TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Tumor incidental histologic finding in 5% or less of tissue resected. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Prostate Cancer cTX TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Prostate Cancer cTX TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Primary tumor cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Prostate Cancer cTX TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Primary tumor cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)
